text:
e="preserve">Leg cricket is a form of cricket where the players don't use a bat. It is played with the batters instead kicking the ball with their legs, and there is a distance of only about from the kicker to the edge of the field. The ball is delivered to the kicker underarm by the bowler.
Measurements.
The pitch is wide and 42 ft to 48 ft long, (based on the age group and category of the players).
